intro: Geissorhiza quinquangularis, commonly known as the five-angled geissorhiza, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, angular, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces tuberous roots that store nutrients, enabling it to survive in dry conditions. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. The flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
